cont.entity_a: The card did not work with Windows Vista Ultimate, despite the description.
cont.entity_b: The card did not work with RedHat 5.5 or Xubuntu 9.04 Linux due to driver errors.

Installation.comm: The card is easy to install.

cont.entity_a: Installation was smooth and took less than 10 minutes.
cont.entity_b: Installation was quick, and connection is superb at max rate.

cont.entity_a: Technical support was unhelpful, focusing on collecting personal information.
cont.entity_b: Trendnet's customer service is very good.

cont.entity_a: The range and speed are inadequate.
cont.entity_b: The card has poor range compared to older wifi cards.

cont.entity_a: Netgear's software has connectivity issues; it's better to use Windows control.
cont.entity_b: Software management was ineffective, requiring reliance on XP for management.

cont.entity_a: The card offers faster speed and broader coverage as advertised.
cont.entity_b: Not faster in N-mode compared to Cisco in G-mode, despite higher transmission speed claims.

cont.entity_a: The card is easy to install and improves wireless connection stability.
cont.entity_b: Stability issues with the card, requiring manual reconnects.

cont.entity_a: The N card works well with the Netgear dual band router, enabling internet connectivity in the garage.
cont.entity_b: Frequent connection loss even when close to the router.

cont.entity_a: The CPU usage goes to 80% when the card is plugged in, with no known fix.
Good product with fantastic price and fast shipping.
